ofx:section.ofx:title: Constraints and Validity Checks
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: The aspect of plausibility checks and data constrains is fundamental in software development. In this information system the mechanisms to ensure the validation and consistence of data are technically realized on different levels.

l:item.ofx:paragraph: The \gls{c16} \gls{c14} are located on database level and enforce the \gls{c17}. E.g. it's not allowed to delete an object which is used somewhere else.
The data type constraints are located in the \gls{c18} and ensure that the entered data types are correct. The system is checking e.g. that a amount is a decimal number and not a \gls{c19}.

The plausibility checks (e.g. that a national ID needs to start with 1 and requires 16 digits or that a real start date should never be prior to the planned start date) are located at the application logic.

ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: In all cases, the user interface will inform the \gls{c13}, if plausibility checks fail or any constraint might be violated. The constraints are documented in this manual to enhance the understanding of the user for the internal processes of the system.
